results.title: Heart disease
results.brief_description: Neil created this story as a document of how surviving a heart attack completely changed his life. Created as part of ‘The Heart of the Story / Telling Stories, Building Communities’ Digital Storytelling Project ACMI in association with the National Heart Foundation of Australia (Victorian Division) and supported by Vic Health.

results.title: For my girls
results.brief_description: Gabby uses her Digital Story to tell her daughters about the inspiring life of their father, who died of a heart attack at the age of 31. Created as part of ‘The Heart of the Story’ an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with the National Heart Foundation of Australia (Victorian Division) and in partnership with VicHealth.

results.title: [Kodak Cinegraph compilation. No. 08]
results.brief_description: A compilation of newsreel segments focusing on Australia. 1. ‘[Royal Melbourne Zoo]’ shows a family strolling through the zoo. 2. ‘[Nar Nar Goon Airport]’ 3. ‘Turtle Island’ includes footage of giant turtles on the beach, men riding the turtles in a light-hearted race, and a dead turtle being cut open to show its heart which continues to beat 48 hours after death. 4. ‘[Peach growing in Australia]’ captures Australia’s fruit growing and canning industry in the 30’s showing the orchards, the sorting and inspection area, women peeling and removing stones, and the mechanised canning and processing sections.

results.title: [Kodak Cinegraph compilation. No. 12]
results.creator_credit: Kodak Cinegraph and Commonwealth Government of Australia
results.brief_description: A compilation of short newsreel segments. 1. ‘Where traffic is all wet’ captures the hustle and bustle of Shanghai harbour, followed by a Japanese harbour showing a ferry designed to take boats overland and a water tunnel. 2. ‘Glimpses of Australia’ takes a look at seals and penguins on Lady Julia Percy Island located 200 miles from Melbourne. 3. ‘A Glimpse of Canberra’ produced by the Development and Migration Commision visits parliament House. 4. ‘[Melbourne Zoo] shows Jimmy the champanzee, ostriches, tigers, lions, leopards, bears and a novelty segment showing a Mr Wilkie tugging at the tail of an accommodating tiger.

results.title: [Kodak Cinegraph compilation. No. 07]
results.brief_description: A compilation of early silent footage featuring Australian and North American wildlife. Shows kangaroos, wallabies, bandicoots, opossum (including an albino opossum), wombat, koala, Tasmanian devil, platypus and echidna. Also shows footage at a real rodeo in Pendleton, Oregon and a fight betweena cobra and a mongoose.

results.title: A Floral pageant
results.brief_description: Victoria celebrates 100 years of self government. Shots of the Royal Botanic Gardens, Government House, but mainly the procession along Elizabeth Street. Beginning title says “Presented by Ted Waterford”.

results.title: Men in wool
results.creator_credit: Frank Land and Australian Wool Corporation
results.brief_description: Designed to show the importance of wool in the manufacture of men’s clothing, tracking the cycle from the shearing shed to the tailored suit. Illustrates the process of shearing, grading, scouring and carding and explains the range of tests for strength, elasticity and possible imperfections. Finally shows the manufacture of a suit using mass productions and hand tailoring techniques. Photographed by George Heath; narrated by Michael Charlton; edited by Les Wasley; script by John Moyes Junior; sound by Allyn Barnes.

results.title: [Royal guest XVI Olympiad 1956]
results.brief_description: A historical record of Prince Philip’s visit to Melbourne during the 1956 Olympic Games. Captures his airport arrival; the public lining Melbourne’s streets to greet the Prince; his visit to Government House; a parade on Swanston street showing a glimpse of Melbourne Town Hall; the opening ceremony at Olympic Games; Robert Menzies and Prince Philip arriving at the Olympic stadium; entrance of athletes at the opening ceremony; Ron Clarke’s memorable entrance into the stadium and the lighting of the Olympic flame; footage of Station Pier in Port Melbourne; Philip arriving at St Paul’s cathedral in Melbourne; an extensive tour of the accomodation facilities prepared for the athletes at Olympic Village in Heidelberg; Philip visit a hospital and the Australian Paper Manufacturers mill in Heidelberg; shows footage of various track and field events in the stadium; a ceremony at Melbourne’s Shrine of Rememberance; the departure of Prince Philip.

results.title: Bushland fantasy
results.creator_credit: Soundmasters and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Provides glimpses of the many wild flowers and animals found in the Australian bush. Includes photographs of native flora, and animal life such as kangaroos, wallabies, platypus, lyrebirds and koalas. Many of these can be found in the wildlife sanctuary at Healesville where special efforts are made to arrange a proper diet for these animals. Narrated by John Dudley.
